intro: Lobelia gattingeri, commonly known as the Gattinger's lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
